Browser.name: Browser

close.name: close
close.comment:
In case this browser is obtained using browserType.launch, closes the browser and all of its pages (if any were opened).
In case this browser is obtained using browserType.connect, clears all created contexts belonging to this browser and disconnects from the browser server.
The Browser object itself is considered to be disposed and cannot be used anymore.

contexts.name: contexts
contexts.comment:
Returns an array of all open browser contexts. In a newly created browser, this will return zero
browser contexts.
```js
const browser = await pw.webkit.launch();
console.log(browser.contexts().length); // prints `0`

const context = await browser.newContext();
console.log(browser.contexts().length); // prints `1`
```

isConnected.name: isConnected
isConnected.comment: Indicates that the browser is connected.

newContext.name: newContext

acceptDownloads.name: acceptDownloads
acceptDownloads.comment: Whether to automatically download all the attachments. Defaults to `false` where all the downloads are canceled.

ignoreHTTPSErrors.name: ignoreHTTPSErrors
ignoreHTTPSErrors.comment: Whether to ignore HTTPS errors during navigation. Defaults to `false`.

viewport.name: viewport
viewport.comment: Sets a consistent viewport for each page. Defaults to an 1280x720 viewport. `null` disables the default viewport.

userAgent.name: userAgent
userAgent.comment: Specific user agent to use in this context.

deviceScaleFactor.name: deviceScaleFactor
deviceScaleFactor.comment: Specify device scale factor (can be thought of as dpr). Defaults to `1`.

isMobile.name: isMobile
isMobile.comment: Whether the `meta viewport` tag is taken into account and touch events are enabled. Defaults to `false`. Not supported in Firefox.

hasTouch.name: hasTouch
hasTouch.comment: Specifies if viewport supports touch events. Defaults to false.

javaScriptEnabled.name: javaScriptEnabled
javaScriptEnabled.comment: Whether or not to enable JavaScript in the context. Defaults to true.

timezoneId.name: timezoneId
timezoneId.comment: Changes the timezone of the context. See ICU’s `metaZones.txt` for a list of supported timezone IDs.

locale.name: locale
locale.comment: Specify user locale, for example `en-GB`, `de-DE`, etc. Locale will affect `navigator.language` value, `Accept-Language` request header value as well as number and date formatting rules.

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.comment: A list of permissions to grant to all pages in this context. See browserContext.grantPermissions for more details.

extraHTTPHeaders.name: extraHTTPHeaders
extraHTTPHeaders.comment: An object containing additional HTTP headers to be sent with every request. All header values must be strings.

offline.name: offline
offline.comment: Whether to emulate network being offline. Defaults to `false`.

colorScheme.name: colorScheme
colorScheme.comment: Emulates `'prefers-colors-scheme'` media feature, supported values are `'light'`, `'dark'`, `'no-preference'`. See page.emulateMedia(options) for more details. Defaults to '`light`'.

proxy.name: proxy

server.name: server
server.comment: Proxy to be used for all requests. HTTP and SOCKS proxies are supported, for example `http://myproxy.com:3128` or `socks5://myproxy.com:3128`. Short form `myproxy.com:3128` is considered an HTTP proxy.

bypass.name: bypass
bypass.comment: Optional coma-separated domains to bypass proxy, for example `".com, chromium.org, .domain.com"`.

username.name: username
username.comment: Optional username to use if HTTP proxy requires authentication.

password.name: password
password.comment: Optional password to use if HTTP proxy requires authentication.

proxy.comment: Network proxy settings to use with this context. Note that browser needs to be launched with the global proxy for this option to work. If all contexts override the proxy, global proxy will be never used and can be any string, for example `launch({ proxy: { server: 'per-context' } })`.

videosPath.name: videosPath
videosPath.comment: Enables video recording for all pages to `videosPath` folder. If not specified, videos are not recorded. Make sure to await `browserContext.close` for videos to be saved.

videoSize.name: videoSize
videoSize.comment: Specifies dimensions of the automatically recorded video. Can only be used if `videosPath` is set. If not specified the size will be equal to `viewport`. If `viewport` is not configured explicitly the video size defaults to 1280x720. Actual picture of the page will be scaled down if necessary to fit specified size.

recordHar.name: recordHar

omitContent.name: omitContent
omitContent.comment: Optional setting to control whether to omit request content from the HAR. Defaults to `false`.

path.name: path
path.comment: Path on the filesystem to write the HAR file to.

recordHar.comment: Enables HAR recording for all pages into `har.path` file. If not specified, the HAR is not recorded. Make sure to await `browserContext.close` for the HAR to be saved.

newPage.name: newPage
newPage.comment:
Creates a new page in a new browser context. Closing this page will close the context as well.
This is a convenience API that should only be used for the single-page scenarios and short snippets. Production code and testing frameworks should explicitly create browser.newContext followed by the browserContext.newPage to control their exact life times.

acceptDownloads.name: acceptDownloads
acceptDownloads.comment: Whether to automatically download all the attachments. Defaults to `false` where all the downloads are canceled.

ignoreHTTPSErrors.name: ignoreHTTPSErrors
ignoreHTTPSErrors.comment: Whether to ignore HTTPS errors during navigation. Defaults to `false`.

viewport.name: viewport
viewport.comment: Sets a consistent viewport for each page. Defaults to an 1280x720 viewport. `null` disables the default viewport.

userAgent.name: userAgent
userAgent.comment: Specific user agent to use in this context.

deviceScaleFactor.name: deviceScaleFactor
deviceScaleFactor.comment: Specify device scale factor (can be thought of as dpr). Defaults to `1`.

isMobile.name: isMobile
isMobile.comment: Whether the `meta viewport` tag is taken into account and touch events are enabled. Defaults to `false`. Not supported in Firefox.

hasTouch.name: hasTouch
hasTouch.comment: Specifies if viewport supports touch events. Defaults to false.

javaScriptEnabled.name: javaScriptEnabled
javaScriptEnabled.comment: Whether or not to enable JavaScript in the context. Defaults to `true`.

timezoneId.name: timezoneId
timezoneId.comment: Changes the timezone of the context. See ICU’s `metaZones.txt` for a list of supported timezone IDs.

locale.name: locale
locale.comment: Specify user locale, for example `en-GB`, `de-DE`, etc. Locale will affect `navigator.language` value, `Accept-Language` request header value as well as number and date formatting rules.

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.comment: A list of permissions to grant to all pages in this context. See browserContext.grantPermissions for more details.

extraHTTPHeaders.name: extraHTTPHeaders
extraHTTPHeaders.comment: An object containing additional HTTP headers to be sent with every request. All header values must be strings.

offline.name: offline
offline.comment: Whether to emulate network being offline. Defaults to `false`.

colorScheme.name: colorScheme
colorScheme.comment: Emulates `'prefers-colors-scheme'` media feature, supported values are `'light'`, `'dark'`, `'no-preference'`. See page.emulateMedia(options) for more details. Defaults to '`light`'.

server.name: server
server.comment: Proxy to be used for all requests. HTTP and SOCKS proxies are supported, for example `http://myproxy.com:3128` or `socks5://myproxy.com:3128`. Short form `myproxy.com:3128` is considered an HTTP proxy.

bypass.name: bypass
bypass.comment: Optional coma-separated domains to bypass proxy, for example `".com, chromium.org, .domain.com"`.

username.name: username
username.comment: Optional username to use if HTTP proxy requires authentication.

password.name: password

proxy.comment: Network proxy settings to use with this context. Note that browser needs to be launched with the global proxy for this option to work. If all contexts override the proxy, global proxy will be never used and can be any string, for example `launch({ proxy: { server: 'per-context' } })`.

videosPath.name: videosPath
videosPath.comment: Enables video recording for all pages to `videosPath` folder. If not specified, videos are not recorded. Make sure to await `page.close` for videos to be saved.

videoSize.name: videoSize
videoSize.comment: Specifies dimensions of the automatically recorded video. Can only be used if `videosPath` is set. If not specified the size will be equal to `viewport`. If `viewport` is not configured explicitly the video size defaults to 1280x720. Actual picture of the page will be scaled down if necessary to fit specified size.

omitContent.name: omitContent

BrowserContext.name: BrowserContext

url.name: url
url.comment: either url or domain / path are required

domain.name: domain
domain.comment: either url or domain / path are required

path.name: path
path.comment: either url or domain / path are required

addInitScript.name: addInitScript

script.name: script

path.name: path
path.comment: Path to the JavaScript file. If `path` is a relative path, then it is resolved relative to current working directory.

script.comment: Script to be evaluated in all pages in the browser context.

arg.name: arg
arg.comment: Optional argument to pass to `script` (only supported when passing a function).

browser.name: browser
browser.returnComment: Returns the browser instance of the context. If it was launched as a persistent context null gets returned.

clearPermissions.name: clearPermissions

close.name: close
close.comment:
Closes the browser context. All the pages that belong to the browser context
will be closed.

**NOTE** the default browser context cannot be closed.

cookies.name: cookies
cookies.comment:
If no URLs are specified, this method returns all cookies.
If URLs are specified, only cookies that affect those URLs are returned.

exposeBinding.name: exposeBinding

name.name: name
name.comment: Name of the function on the window object.

playwrightBinding.name: playwrightBinding
playwrightBinding.comment: Callback function that will be called in the Playwright's context.

handle.name: handle
handle.comment: Whether to pass the argument as a handle, instead of passing by value. When passing a handle, only one argument is supported. When passing by value, multiple arguments are supported.

exposeFunction.name: exposeFunction

name.name: name
name.comment: Name of the function on the window object.

playwrightFunction.name: playwrightFunction
playwrightFunction.comment: Callback function that will be called in the Playwright's context.

grantPermissions.name: grantPermissions
grantPermissions.comment: Grants specified permissions to the browser context. Only grants corresponding permissions to the given origin if specified.

permissions.name: permissions
permissions.comment:
A permission or an array of permissions to grant. Permissions can be one of the following values:
 - `'geolocation'`
 - `'midi'`
 - `'midi-sysex'` (system-exclusive midi)
 - `'notifications'`
 - `'push'`
 - `'camera'`
 - `'microphone'`
 - `'background-sync'`
 - `'ambient-light-sensor'`
 - `'accelerometer'`
 - `'gyroscope'`
 - `'magnetometer'`
 - `'accessibility-events'`
 - `'clipboard-read'`
 - `'clipboard-write'`
 - `'payment-handler'`

origin.name: origin
origin.comment: The origin to grant permissions to, e.g. "https://example.com".

newPage.name: newPage
newPage.comment: Creates a new page in the browser context.

pages.name: pages
pages.returnComment: All open pages in the context. Non visible pages, such as `"background_page"`, will not be listed here. You can find them using chromiumBrowserContext.backgroundPages().

route.name: route

url.name: url
url.comment: A glob pattern, regex pattern or predicate receiving URL to match while routing.

handler.name: handler
handler.comment: handler function to route the request.

setDefaultNavigationTimeout.name: setDefaultNavigationTimeout
setDefaultNavigationTimeout.comment:
This setting will change the default maximum navigation time for the following methods and related shortcuts:

page.goBack([options])
page.goForward([options])
page.goto(url[, options])
page.reload([options])
page.setContent(html[, options])
page.waitForNavigation([options])


**NOTE** `page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout` and `page.setDefaultTimeout` take priority over `browserContext.setDefaultNavigationTimeout`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum navigation time in milliseconds

setDefaultTimeout.name: setDefaultTimeout
setDefaultTimeout.comment:
This setting will change the default maximum time for all the methods accepting `timeout` option.

**NOTE** `page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout`, `page.setDefaultTimeout` and `browserContext.setDefaultNavigationTimeout` take priority over `browserContext.setDefaultTimeout`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds

setExtraHTTPHeaders.name: setExtraHTTPHeaders
setExtraHTTPHeaders.comment:
The extra HTTP headers will be sent with every request initiated by any page in the context. These headers are merged with page-specific extra HTTP headers set with page.setExtraHTTPHeaders(). If page overrides a particular header, page-specific header value will be used instead of the browser context header value.

**NOTE** `browserContext.setExtraHTTPHeaders` does not guarantee the order of headers in the outgoing requests.

headers.name: headers
headers.comment: An object containing additional HTTP headers to be sent with every request. All header values must be strings.

setGeolocation.name: setGeolocation
setGeolocation.comment:
Sets the context's geolocation. Passing `null` or `undefined` emulates position unavailable.
```js
await browserContext.setGeolocation({latitude: 59.95, longitude: 30.31667});
```

**NOTE** Consider using browserContext.grantPermissions to grant permissions for the browser context pages to read its geolocation.

setHTTPCredentials.name: setHTTPCredentials
setHTTPCredentials.comment:
Provide credentials for HTTP authentication.

**NOTE** Browsers may cache credentials after successful authentication. Passing different credentials or passing `null` to disable authentication will be unreliable. To remove or replace credentials, create a new browser context instead.

offline.name: offline
offline.comment: Whether to emulate network being offline for the browser context.

unroute.name: unroute
unroute.comment: Removes a route created with browserContext.route(url, handler). When `handler` is not specified, removes all routes for the `url`.

url.name: url
url.comment: A glob pattern, regex pattern or predicate receiving URL used to register a routing with browserContext.route(url, handler).

handler.name: handler
handler.comment: Handler function used to register a routing with browserContext.route(url, handler).

waitForEvent.name: waitForEvent
waitForEvent.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the event data value.

event.name: event
event.comment: Event name, same one would pass into `browserContext.on(event)`.

optionsOrPredicate.name: optionsOrPredicate

predicate.name: predicate
predicate.comment: receives the event data and resolves to truthy value when the waiting should resolve.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: maximum time to wait for in milliseconds. Defaults to `30000` (30 seconds). Pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout).

optionsOrPredicate.comment: Either a predicate that receives an event or an options object.

page.name: page

Page.name: Page

$.comment:
The method finds an element matching the specified selector within the page. If no elements match the selector, the return value resolves to `null`.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().$(selector).

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query page for. See working with selectors for more details.

$$.comment:
The method finds all elements matching the specified selector within the page. If no elements match the selector, the return value resolves to `[]`.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().$$(selector).

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query page for. See working with selectors for more details.

$eval.name: $eval
$eval.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction`

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query page for. See working with selectors for more details.

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in browser context

$$eval.name: $$eval
$$eval.comment:
The method finds all elements matching the specified selector within the page and passes an array of matched elements as a first argument to `pageFunction`.
If `pageFunction` returns a Promise, then `page.$$eval` would wait for the promise to resolve and return its value.
Examples:
```js
const divsCounts = await page.$$eval('div', (divs, min) => divs.length >= min, 10);
```
$$eval.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction`

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query page for. See working with selectors for more details.

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in browser context

addInitScript.name: addInitScript

script.name: script

path.name: path
path.comment: Path to the JavaScript file. If `path` is a relative path, then it is resolved relative to current working directory.

script.comment: Script to be evaluated in the page.

arg.name: arg
arg.comment: Optional argument to pass to `script` (only supported when passing a function).

addScriptTag.name: addScriptTag
addScriptTag.comment:
Adds a `<script>` tag into the page with the desired url or content.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().addScriptTag(options).
addScriptTag.returnComment: which resolves to the added tag when the script's onload fires or when the script content was injected into frame.

url.name: url
url.comment: URL of a script to be added.

path.name: path
path.comment: Path to the JavaScript file to be injected into frame. If `path` is a relative path, then it is resolved relative to current working directory.

content.name: content
content.comment: Raw JavaScript content to be injected into frame.

type.name: type
type.comment: Script type. Use 'module' in order to load a Javascript ES6 module. See script for more details.

addStyleTag.name: addStyleTag
addStyleTag.comment:
Adds a `<link rel="stylesheet">` tag into the page with the desired url or a `<style type="text/css">` tag with the content.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().addStyleTag(options).
addStyleTag.returnComment: which resolves to the added tag when the stylesheet's onload fires or when the CSS content was injected into frame.

url.name: url
url.comment: URL of the `<link>` tag.

path.name: path
path.comment: Path to the CSS file to be injected into frame. If `path` is a relative path, then it is resolved relative to current working directory.

content.name: content
content.comment: Raw CSS content to be injected into frame.

check.name: check
check.comment:
This method checks an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Ensure that matched element is a checkbox or a radio input. If not, this method rejects. If the element is already checked, this method returns immediately.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to click in the center of the element.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.
Ensure that the element is now checked. If not, this method rejects.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().check(selector[, options]).
check.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully checked.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for checkbox or radio button to check. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be checked. See working with selectors for more details.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

click.name: click
click.comment:
This method clicks an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to click in the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().click(selector[, options]).
click.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully clicked.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to click. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be clicked. See working with selectors for more details.

delay.name: delay
delay.comment: Time to wait between `mousedown` and `mouseup` in milliseconds. Defaults to 0.

position.name: position
position.comment: A point to click relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, clicks to some visible point of the element.

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.comment: Modifier keys to press. Ensures that only these modifiers are pressed during the click, and then restores current modifiers back. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

close.name: close
close.comment:
If `runBeforeUnload` is `false` the result will resolve only after the page has been closed.
If `runBeforeUnload` is `true` the method will **not** wait for the page to close.
By default, `page.close()` **does not** run beforeunload handlers.

**NOTE** if `runBeforeUnload` is passed as true, a `beforeunload` dialog might be summoned
and should be handled manually via page's 'dialog' event.

runBeforeUnload.name: runBeforeUnload
runBeforeUnload.comment:
Defaults to `false`. Whether to run the
before unload
page handlers.

content.name: content
content.comment: Gets the full HTML contents of the page, including the doctype.

context.name: context
context.comment: Get the browser context that the page belongs to.

dblclick.name: dblclick
dblclick.comment:
This method double clicks an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to double click in the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set. Note that if the first click of the `dblclick()` triggers a navigation event, this method will reject.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.

**NOTE** `page.dblclick()` dispatches two `click` events and a single `dblclick` event.

Shortcut for page.mainFrame().dblclick(selector[, options]).
dblclick.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully double clicked.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to double click. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be double clicked. See working with selectors for more details.

delay.name: delay
delay.comment: Time to wait between `mousedown` and `mouseup` in milliseconds. Defaults to 0.

position.name: position
position.comment: A point to double click relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, double clicks to some visible point of the element.

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.comment: Modifier keys to press. Ensures that only these modifiers are pressed during the double click, and then restores current modifiers back. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

dispatchEvent.name: dispatchEvent
dispatchEvent.comment:
The snippet below dispatches the `click` event on the element. Regardless of the visibility state of the elment, `click` is dispatched. This is equivalend to calling `element.click()`.
```js
await page.dispatchEvent('button#submit', 'click');
```
Under the hood, it creates an instance of an event based on the given `type`, initializes it with `eventInit` properties and dispatches it on the element. Events are `composed`, `cancelable` and bubble by default.
Since `eventInit` is event-specific, please refer to the events documentation for the lists of initial properties:

DragEvent
FocusEvent
KeyboardEvent
MouseEvent
PointerEvent
TouchEvent
Event

You can also specify `JSHandle` as the property value if you want live objects to be passed into the event:
```js
// Note you can only create DataTransfer in Chromium and Firefox
const dataTransfer = await page.evaluateHandle(() => new DataTransfer());
await page.dispatchEvent('#source', 'dragstart', { dataTransfer });
```

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to use. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used. See working with selectors for more details.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

emulateMedia.name: emulateMedia

media.name: media
media.comment: Changes the CSS media type of the page. The only allowed values are `'screen'`, `'print'` and `null`. Passing `null` disables CSS media emulation. Omitting `media` or passing `undefined` does not change the emulated value.

colorScheme.name: colorScheme
colorScheme.comment: Emulates `'prefers-colors-scheme'` media feature, supported values are `'light'`, `'dark'`, `'no-preference'`. Passing `null` disables color scheme emulation. Omitting `colorScheme` or passing `undefined` does not change the emulated value.

evaluate.name: evaluate
evaluate.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction`

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in the page context

evaluateHandle.name: evaluateHandle
evaluateHandle.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction` as in-page object (JSHandle)

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in the page context

exposeBinding.name: exposeBinding

name.name: name
name.comment: Name of the function on the window object.

playwrightBinding.name: playwrightBinding
playwrightBinding.comment: Callback function that will be called in the Playwright's context.

handle.name: handle
handle.comment: Whether to pass the argument as a handle, instead of passing by value. When passing a handle, only one argument is supported. When passing by value, multiple arguments are supported.

exposeFunction.name: exposeFunction

name.name: name
name.comment: Name of the function on the window object

playwrightFunction.name: playwrightFunction
playwrightFunction.comment: Callback function which will be called in Playwright's context.

fill.name: fill
fill.comment:
This method waits for an element matching `selector`, waits for actionability checks, focuses the element, fills it and triggers an `input` event after filling.
If the element matching `selector` is not an `<input>`, `<textarea>` or `[contenteditable]` element, this method throws an error.
Note that you can pass an empty string to clear the input field.
To send fine-grained keyboard events, use `page.type`.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().fill()

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query page for. See working with selectors for more details.

value.name: value
value.comment: Value to fill for the `<input>`, `<textarea>` or `[contenteditable]` element.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter

goto.name: goto
goto.comment:
`page.goto` will throw an error if:

there's an SSL error (e.g. in case of self-signed certificates).
target URL is invalid.
the `timeout` is exceeded during navigation.
the remote server does not respond or is unreachable.
the main resource failed to load.

`page.goto` will not throw an error when any valid HTTP status code is returned by the remote server, including 404 "Not Found" and 500 "Internal Server Error".  The status code for such responses can be retrieved by calling response.status().

**NOTE** `page.goto` either throws an error or returns a main resource response. The only exceptions are navigation to `about:blank` or navigation to the same URL with a different hash, which would succeed and return `null`.


**NOTE** Headless mode doesn't support navigation to a PDF document. See the upstream issue.

Shortcut for page.mainFrame().goto(url[, options])
goto.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the main resource response. In case of multiple redirects, the navigation will resolve with the response of the last redirect.

 - `'networkidle'` - consider navigation to be finished when there are no network connections for at least `500` ms.

hover.name: hover
hover.comment:
This method hovers over an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to hover over the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().hover(selector[, options]).
hover.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully hovered.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to hover. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be hovered. See working with selectors for more details.

position.name: position
position.comment: A point to hover relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, hovers over some visible point of the element.

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.comment: Modifier keys to press. Ensures that only these modifiers are pressed during the hover, and then restores current modifiers back. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

pdf.name: pdf
pdf.comment:
**NOTE** Generating a pdf is currently only supported in Chromium headless.

`page.pdf()` generates a pdf of the page with `print` css media. To generate a pdf with `screen` media, call page.emulateMedia({ media: 'screen' }) before calling `page.pdf()`:

**NOTE** By default, `page.pdf()` generates a pdf with modified colors for printing. Use the `-webkit-print-color-adjust` property to force rendering of exact colors.

```js
// Generates a PDF with 'screen' media type.
await page.emulateMedia({media: 'screen'});
await page.pdf({path: 'page.pdf'});
```
The `width`, `height`, and `margin` options accept values labeled with units. Unlabeled values are treated as pixels.
A few examples:

`page.pdf({width: 100})` - prints with width set to 100 pixels
`page.pdf({width: '100px'})` - prints with width set to 100 pixels
`page.pdf({width: '10cm'})` - prints with width set to 10 centimeters.

All possible units are:

`px` - pixel
`in` - inch
`cm` - centimeter
`mm` - millimeter

The `format` options are:

`Letter`: 8.5in x 11in
`Legal`: 8.5in x 14in
`Tabloid`: 11in x 17in
`Ledger`: 17in x 11in
`A0`: 33.1in x 46.8in
`A1`: 23.4in x 33.1in
`A2`: 16.54in x 23.4in
`A3`: 11.7in x 16.54in
`A4`: 8.27in x 11.7in
`A5`: 5.83in x 8.27in
`A6`: 4.13in x 5.83in


**NOTE** `headerTemplate` and `footerTemplate` markup have the following limitations:

Script tags inside templates are not evaluated.
Page styles are not visible inside templates.
pdf.returnComment: Promise which resolves with PDF buffer.

path.name: path
path.comment: The file path to save the PDF to. If `path` is a relative path, then it is resolved relative to current working directory. If no path is provided, the PDF won't be saved to the disk.

scale.comment: Scale of the webpage rendering. Defaults to `1`. Scale amount must be between 0.1 and 2.

displayHeaderFooter.name: displayHeaderFooter
displayHeaderFooter.comment: Display header and footer. Defaults to `false`.

headerTemplate.name: headerTemplate
headerTemplate.comment:
HTML template for the print header. Should be valid HTML markup with following classes used to inject printing values into them:
 - `'date'` formatted print date
 - `'title'` document title
 - `'url'` document location
 - `'pageNumber'` current page number
 - `'totalPages'` total pages in the document

footerTemplate.name: footerTemplate
footerTemplate.comment: HTML template for the print footer. Should use the same format as the `headerTemplate`.

pageRanges.name: pageRanges
pageRanges.comment: Paper ranges to print, e.g., '1-5, 8, 11-13'. Defaults to the empty string, which means print all pages.

format.name: format
format.comment: Paper format. If set, takes priority over `width` or `height` options. Defaults to 'Letter'.

preferCSSPageSize.comment: Give any CSS `@page` size declared in the page priority over what is declared in `width` and `height` or `format` options. Defaults to `false`, which will scale the content to fit the paper size.

tap.comment:
This method taps an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.touchscreen to tap the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.

**NOTE** `page.tap()` requires that the `hasTouch` option of the browser context be set to true.

Shortcut for page.mainFrame().tap().
tap.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully tapped.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to tap. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be tapped. See working with selectors for more details.

position.comment: A point to tap relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, taps some visible point of the element.

type.comment:
Sends a `keydown`, `keypress`/`input`, and `keyup` event for each character in the text. `page.type` can be used to send fine-grained keyboard events. To fill values in form fields, use `page.fill`.
To press a special key, like `Control` or `ArrowDown`, use `keyboard.press`.
```js
await page.type('#mytextarea', 'Hello'); // Types instantly
await page.type('#mytextarea', 'World', {delay: 100}); // Types slower, like a user
```
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().type(selector, text[, options]).

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector of an element to type into. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used. See working with selectors for more details.

You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

uncheck.name: uncheck
uncheck.comment:
This method unchecks an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Ensure that matched element is a checkbox or a radio input. If not, this method rejects. If the element is already unchecked, this method returns immediately.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to click in the center of the element.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.
Ensure that the element is now unchecked. If not, this method rejects.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().uncheck(selector[, options]).
uncheck.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully unchecked.

You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

options.comment: Optional waiting parameters

waitForLoadState.name: waitForLoadState
waitForLoadState.comment:
This resolves when the page reaches a required load state, `load` by default. The navigation must have been committed when this method is called. If current document has already reached the required state, resolves immediately.
```js
await page.click('button'); // Click triggers navigation.
await page.waitForLoadState(); // The promise resolves after 'load' event.
```
```js
const [popup] = await Promise.all([
  page.waitForEvent('popup'),
  page.click('button'), // Click triggers a popup.
])
await popup.waitForLoadState('domcontentloaded'); // The promise resolves after 'domcontentloaded' event.
console.log(await popup.title()); // Popup is ready to use.
```
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().waitForLoadState([options]).
waitForLoadState.returnComment: Promise which resolves when the required load state has been reached.

state.name: state
state.comment:
Load state to wait for, defaults to `load`. If the state has been already reached while loading current document, the method resolves immediately.
 - `'load'` - wait for the `load` event to be fired.
 - `'domcontentloaded'` - wait for the `DOMContentLoaded` event to be fired.
 - `'networkidle'` - wait until there are no network connections for at least `500` ms.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum waiting time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout), browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout), page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

waitForNavigation.name: waitForNavigation
waitForNavigation.comment:
This resolves when the page navigates to a new URL or reloads. It is useful for when you run code
which will indirectly cause the page to navigate. e.g. The click target has an `onclick` handler that triggers navigation from a `setTimeout`. Consider this example:
```js
const [response] = await Promise.all([
  page.waitForNavigation(), // The promise resolves after navigation has finished
  page.click('a.delayed-navigation'), // Clicking the link will indirectly cause a navigation
]);
```
**NOTE** Usage of the History API to change the URL is considered a navigation.
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().waitForNavigation(options).
waitForNavigation.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the main resource response. In case of multiple redirects, the navigation will resolve with the response of the last redirect. In case of navigation to a different anchor or navigation due to History API usage, the navigation will resolve with `null`.

options.name: options

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum navigation time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout), browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout), page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

url.name: url
url.comment: A glob pattern, regex pattern or predicate receiving URL to match while waiting for the navigation.

waitUntil.name: waitUntil
waitUntil.comment:
When to consider navigation succeeded, defaults to `load`. Events can be either:
 - `'domcontentloaded'` - consider navigation to be finished when the `DOMContentLoaded` event is fired.
 - `'load'` - consider navigation to be finished when the `load` event is fired.
 - `'networkidle'` - consider navigation to be finished when there are no network connections for at least `500` ms.

options.comment: Navigation parameters which might have the following properties:

waitForRequest.name: waitForRequest
waitForRequest.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the matched request.

urlOrPredicate.name: urlOrPredicate
urlOrPredicate.comment: Request URL string, regex or predicate receiving Request object.

options.name: options

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum wait time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable the timeout. The default value can be changed by using the page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) method.

options.comment: Optional waiting parameters

waitForResponse.name: waitForResponse
waitForResponse.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the matched response.

urlOrPredicate.name: urlOrPredicate
urlOrPredicate.comment: Request URL string, regex or predicate receiving Response object.

options.name: options

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum wait time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable the timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

options.comment: Optional waiting parameters

waitForSelector.name: waitForSelector
waitForSelector.returnComment: Promise which resolves when element specified by selector satisfies `state` option. Resolves to `null` if waiting for `hidden` or `detached`.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector of an element to wait for. See working with selectors for more details.

state.name: state
state.comment:
Defaults to `'visible'`. Can be either:
 - `'attached'` - wait for element to be present in DOM.
 - `'detached'` - wait for element to not be present in DOM.
 - `'visible'` - wait for element to have non-empty bounding box and no `visibility:hidden`. Note that element without any content or with `display:none` has an empty bounding box and is not considered visible.
 - `'hidden'` - wait for element to be either detached from DOM, or have an empty bounding box or `visibility:hidden`. This is opposite to the `'visible'` option.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

waitForTimeout.name: waitForTimeout
waitForTimeout.comment:
Returns a promise that resolves after the timeout.
Note that `page.waitForTimeout()` should only be used for debugging. Tests using the timer in production are going to be flaky. Use signals such as network events, selectors becoming visible and others instead.
```js
// wait for 1 second
await page.waitForTimeout(1000);
```
Shortcut for page.mainFrame().waitForTimeout(timeout).

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: A timeout to wait for

workers.name: workers
workers.returnComment: This method returns all of the dedicated WebWorkers associated with the page.

console.name: console

crash.name: crash

dialog.name: dialog
dialog.comment: Emitted when a JavaScript dialog appears, such as `alert`, `prompt`, `confirm` or `beforeunload`. Playwright can respond to the dialog via Dialog's accept or dismiss methods.

domcontentloaded.name: domcontentloaded
domcontentloaded.comment: Emitted when the JavaScript `DOMContentLoaded` event is dispatched.

download.name: download
download.comment:
Emitted when attachment download started. User can access basic file operations on downloaded content via the passed Download instance.

**NOTE** Browser context **must** be created with the `acceptDownloads` set to `true` when user needs access to the downloaded content. If `acceptDownloads` is not set or set to `false`, download events are emitted, but the actual download is not performed and user has no access to the downloaded files.

filechooser.name: filechooser

frameattached.name: frameattached
frameattached.comment: Emitted when a frame is attached.

framedetached.name: framedetached
framedetached.comment: Emitted when a frame is detached.

framenavigated.name: framenavigated
framenavigated.comment: Emitted when a frame is navigated to a new url.

load.name: load
load.comment: Emitted when the JavaScript `load` event is dispatched.

pageerror.name: pageerror
pageerror.comment: Emitted when an uncaught exception happens within the page.

popup.name: popup

request.name: request
request.comment:
Emitted when a page issues a request. The request object is read-only.
In order to intercept and mutate requests, see `page.route()` or `browserContext.route()`.

requestfailed.name: requestfailed
requestfailed.comment:
Emitted when a request fails, for example by timing out.

**NOTE** HTTP Error responses, such as 404 or 503, are still successful responses from HTTP standpoint, so request will complete with `'requestfinished'` event and not with `'requestfailed'`.

requestfinished.name: requestfinished
requestfinished.comment: Emitted when a request finishes successfully after downloading the response body. For a successful response, the sequence of events is `request`, `response` and `requestfinished`.

response.name: response
response.comment: Emitted when response status and headers are received for a request. For a successful response, the sequence of events is `request`, `response` and `requestfinished`.

worker.name: worker
worker.comment: Emitted when a dedicated WebWorker is spawned by the page.

coverage.name: coverage
coverage.comment: Browser-specific Coverage implementation, only available for Chromium atm. See ChromiumCoverage for more details.

Frame.name: Frame

$.comment: The method finds an element matching the specified selector within the frame. See Working with selectors for more details. If no elements match the selector, the return value resolves to `null`.
$.returnComment: Promise which resolves to ElementHandle pointing to the frame element.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query frame for. See working with selectors for more details.

$$.comment: The method finds all elements matching the specified selector within the frame. See Working with selectors for more details. If no elements match the selector, the return value resolves to `[]`.
$$.returnComment: Promise which resolves to ElementHandles pointing to the frame elements.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query frame for. See working with selectors for more details.

$eval.name: $eval
$eval.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction`

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query frame for. See working with selectors for more details.

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in browser context

$$eval.name: $$eval
$$eval.comment:
The method finds all elements matching the specified selector within the frame and passes an array of matched elements as a first argument to `pageFunction`. See Working with selectors for more details.
If `pageFunction` returns a Promise, then `frame.$$eval` would wait for the promise to resolve and return its value.
Examples:
```js
const divsCounts = await frame.$$eval('div', (divs, min) => divs.length >= min, 10);
```
$$eval.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction`

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query frame for. See working with selectors for more details.

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in browser context

addScriptTag.name: addScriptTag
addScriptTag.comment: Adds a `<script>` tag into the page with the desired url or content.
addScriptTag.returnComment: which resolves to the added tag when the script's onload fires or when the script content was injected into frame.

url.name: url
url.comment: URL of a script to be added.

path.name: path
path.comment: Path to the JavaScript file to be injected into frame. If `path` is a relative path, then it is resolved relative to current working directory.

content.name: content
content.comment: Raw JavaScript content to be injected into frame.

type.name: type
type.comment: Script type. Use 'module' in order to load a Javascript ES6 module. See script for more details.

addStyleTag.name: addStyleTag
addStyleTag.comment: Adds a `<link rel="stylesheet">` tag into the page with the desired url or a `<style type="text/css">` tag with the content.
addStyleTag.returnComment: which resolves to the added tag when the stylesheet's onload fires or when the CSS content was injected into frame.

url.name: url
url.comment: URL of the `<link>` tag.

path.name: path
path.comment: Path to the CSS file to be injected into frame. If `path` is a relative path, then it is resolved relative to current working directory.

content.name: content
content.comment: Raw CSS content to be injected into frame.

check.name: check
check.comment:
This method checks an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Ensure that matched element is a checkbox or a radio input. If not, this method rejects. If the element is already checked, this method returns immediately.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to click in the center of the element.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.
Ensure that the element is now checked. If not, this method rejects.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.
check.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully checked.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for checkbox to check. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be checked. See working with selectors for more details.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

click.name: click
click.comment:
This method clicks an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to click in the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.
click.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully clicked.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to click. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be clicked. See working with selectors for more details.

delay.name: delay
delay.comment: Time to wait between `mousedown` and `mouseup` in milliseconds. Defaults to 0.

position.name: position
position.comment: A point to click relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, clicks to some visible point of the element.

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.comment: Modifier keys to press. Ensures that only these modifiers are pressed during the click, and then restores current modifiers back. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

content.name: content
content.comment: Gets the full HTML contents of the frame, including the doctype.

dblclick.name: dblclick
dblclick.comment:
This method double clicks an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to double click in the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set. Note that if the first click of the `dblclick()` triggers a navigation event, this method will reject.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.

**NOTE** `frame.dblclick()` dispatches two `click` events and a single `dblclick` event.
dblclick.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully double clicked.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to double click. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be double clicked. See working with selectors for more details.

delay.name: delay
delay.comment: Time to wait between `mousedown` and `mouseup` in milliseconds. Defaults to 0.

position.name: position
position.comment: A point to double click relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, double clicks to some visible point of the element.

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.comment: Modifier keys to press. Ensures that only these modifiers are pressed during the double click, and then restores current modifiers back. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

dispatchEvent.name: dispatchEvent
dispatchEvent.comment:
The snippet below dispatches the `click` event on the element. Regardless of the visibility state of the elment, `click` is dispatched. This is equivalend to calling `element.click()`.
```js
await frame.dispatchEvent('button#submit', 'click');
```
Under the hood, it creates an instance of an event based on the given `type`, initializes it with `eventInit` properties and dispatches it on the element. Events are `composed`, `cancelable` and bubble by default.
Since `eventInit` is event-specific, please refer to the events documentation for the lists of initial properties:

DragEvent
FocusEvent
KeyboardEvent
MouseEvent
PointerEvent
TouchEvent
Event

You can also specify `JSHandle` as the property value if you want live objects to be passed into the event:
```js
// Note you can only create DataTransfer in Chromium and Firefox
const dataTransfer = await frame.evaluateHandle(() => new DataTransfer());
await frame.dispatchEvent('#source', 'dragstart', { dataTransfer });
```

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to use. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be double clicked. See working with selectors for more details.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

evaluate.name: evaluate
evaluate.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction`

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in browser context

evaluateHandle.name: evaluateHandle
evaluateHandle.comment:
The only difference between `frame.evaluate` and `frame.evaluateHandle` is that `frame.evaluateHandle` returns in-page object (JSHandle).
If the function, passed to the `frame.evaluateHandle`, returns a Promise, then `frame.evaluateHandle` would wait for the promise to resolve and return its value.
```js
const aWindowHandle = await frame.evaluateHandle(() => Promise.resolve(window));
aWindowHandle; // Handle for the window object.
```
A string can also be passed in instead of a function.
```js
const aHandle = await frame.evaluateHandle('document'); // Handle for the 'document'.
```
JSHandle instances can be passed as an argument to the `frame.evaluateHandle`:
```js
const aHandle = await frame.evaluateHandle(() => document.body);
const resultHandle = await frame.evaluateHandle(([body, suffix]) => body.innerHTML + suffix, [aHandle, 'hello']);
console.log(await resultHandle.jsonValue());
await resultHandle.dispose();
```
evaluateHandle.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the return value of `pageFunction` as in-page object (JSHandle)

pageFunction.name: pageFunction
pageFunction.comment: Function to be evaluated in the page context

fill.name: fill
fill.comment:
This method waits for an element matching `selector`, waits for actionability checks, focuses the element, fills it and triggers an `input` event after filling.
If the element matching `selector` is not an `<input>`, `<textarea>` or `[contenteditable]` element, this method throws an error.
Note that you can pass an empty string to clear the input field.
To send fine-grained keyboard events, use `frame.type`.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query page for. See working with selectors for more details.

value.name: value
value.comment: Value to fill for the `<input>`, `<textarea>` or `[contenteditable]` element.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

focus.name: focus
focus.comment:
This method fetches an element with `selector` and focuses it.
If there's no element matching `selector`, the method waits until a matching element appears in the DOM.
focus.returnComment: Promise which resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully focused. The promise will be rejected if there is no element matching `selector`.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector of an element to focus. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be focused. See working with selectors for more details.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

frameElement.name: frameElement
frameElement.comment:
This is an inverse of elementHandle.contentFrame(). Note that returned handle actually belongs to the parent frame.
This method throws an error if the frame has been detached before `frameElement()` returns.
```js
const frameElement = await frame.frameElement();
const contentFrame = await frameElement.contentFrame();
console.log(frame === contentFrame);  // -> true
```
frameElement.returnComment: Promise that resolves with a `frame` or `iframe` element handle which corresponds to this frame.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be picked. See working with selectors for more details.

name.name: name
name.comment: Attribute name to get the value for.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

goto.name: goto
goto.comment:
`frame.goto` will throw an error if:

there's an SSL error (e.g. in case of self-signed certificates).
target URL is invalid.
the `timeout` is exceeded during navigation.
the remote server does not respond or is unreachable.
the main resource failed to load.

`frame.goto` will not throw an error when any valid HTTP status code is returned by the remote server, including 404 "Not Found" and 500 "Internal Server Error".  The status code for such responses can be retrieved by calling response.status().

**NOTE** `frame.goto` either throws an error or returns a main resource response. The only exceptions are navigation to `about:blank` or navigation to the same URL with a different hash, which would succeed and return `null`.


**NOTE** Headless mode doesn't support navigation to a PDF document. See the upstream issue.
goto.returnComment: Promise which resolves to the main resource response. In case of multiple redirects, the navigation will resolve with the response of the last redirect.

url.name: url
url.comment: URL to navigate frame to. The url should include scheme, e.g. `https://`.

options.name: options

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum navigation time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout), browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout), page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

waitUntil.name: waitUntil
waitUntil.comment:
When to consider navigation succeeded, defaults to `load`. Events can be either:
 - `'domcontentloaded'` - consider navigation to be finished when the `DOMContentLoaded` event is fired.
 - `'load'` - consider navigation to be finished when the `load` event is fired.
 - `'networkidle'` - consider navigation to be finished when there are no network connections for at least `500` ms.

referer.name: referer
referer.comment: Referer header value. If provided it will take preference over the referer header value set by page.setExtraHTTPHeaders().

options.comment: Navigation parameters which might have the following properties:

hover.name: hover
hover.comment:
This method hovers over an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.mouse to hover over the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.
hover.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully hovered.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to hover. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be hovered. See working with selectors for more details.

position.name: position
position.comment: A point to hover relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, hovers over some visible point of the element.

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.comment: Modifier keys to press. Ensures that only these modifiers are pressed during the hover, and then restores current modifiers back. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

force.name: force
force.comment: Whether to bypass the actionability checks. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be picked. See working with selectors for more details.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for an element. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be picked. See working with selectors for more details.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

isDetached.name: isDetached
isDetached.comment: Returns `true` if the frame has been detached, or `false` otherwise.

name.name: name
name.comment:
Returns frame's name attribute as specified in the tag.
If the name is empty, returns the id attribute instead.

**NOTE** This value is calculated once when the frame is created, and will not update if the attribute is changed later.

page.name: page
page.comment: Returns the page containing this frame.

parentFrame.name: parentFrame
parentFrame.returnComment: Parent frame, if any. Detached frames and main frames return `null`.

press.name: press
press.comment:
`key` can specify the intended keyboardEvent.key value or a single character to generate the text for. A superset of the `key` values can be found here. Examples of the keys are:
`F1` - `F12`, `Digit0`- `Digit9`, `KeyA`- `KeyZ`, `Backquote`, `Minus`, `Equal`, `Backslash`, `Backspace`, `Tab`, `Delete`, `Escape`, `ArrowDown`, `End`, `Enter`, `Home`, `Insert`, `PageDown`, `PageUp`, `ArrowRight`, `ArrowUp`, etc.
Following modification shortcuts are also suported: `Shift`, `Control`, `Alt`, `Meta`, `ShiftLeft`.
Holding down `Shift` will type the text that corresponds to the `key` in the upper case.
If `key` is a single character, it is case-sensitive, so the values `a` and `A` will generate different respective texts.
Shortcuts such as `key: "Control+o"` or `key: "Control+Shift+T"` are supported as well. When speficied with the modifier, modifier is pressed and being held while the subsequent key is being pressed.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector of an element to type into. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be used. See working with selectors for more details.

key.name: key
key.comment: Name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `ArrowLeft` or `a`.

delay.name: delay
delay.comment: Time to wait between `keydown` and `keyup` in milliseconds. Defaults to 0.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

selectOption.name: selectOption
selectOption.returnComment: An array of option values that have been successfully selected.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to query frame for. See working with selectors for more details.

values.name: values
values.comment: Options to select. If the `<select>` has the `multiple` attribute, all matching options are selected, otherwise only the first option matching one of the passed options is selected. String values are equivalent to `{value:'string'}`. Option is considered matching if all specified properties match.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

html.name: html
html.comment: HTML markup to assign to the page.

options.name: options

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds for resources to load, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout), browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout), page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

waitUntil.name: waitUntil
waitUntil.comment:
When to consider navigation succeeded, defaults to `load`. Events can be either:
 - `'domcontentloaded'` - consider setting content to be finished when the `DOMContentLoaded` event is fired.
 - `'load'` - consider setting content to be finished when the `load` event is fired.
 - `'networkidle'` - consider setting content to be finished when there are no network connections for at least `500` ms.

options.comment: Parameters which might have the following properties:

setInputFiles.name: setInputFiles
setInputFiles.comment:
This method expects `selector` to point to an input element.
Sets the value of the file input to these file paths or files. If some of the `filePaths` are relative paths, then they are resolved relative to the current working directory. For empty array, clears the selected files.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to click. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be clicked. See working with selectors for more details.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: Maximum time in milliseconds, defaults to 30 seconds, pass `0` to disable timeout. The default value can be changed by using the browserContext.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) or page.setDefaultTimeout(timeout) methods.

tap.name: tap
tap.comment:
This method taps an element matching `selector` by performing the following steps:

Find an element match matching `selector`. If there is none, wait until a matching element is attached to the DOM.
Wait for actionability checks on the matched element, unless `force` option is set. If the element is detached during the checks, the whole action is retried.
Scroll the element into view if needed.
Use page.touchscreen to tap the center of the element, or the specified `position`.
Wait for initiated navigations to either succeed or fail, unless `noWaitAfter` option is set.

When all steps combined have not finished during the specified `timeout`, this method rejects with a TimeoutError. Passing zero timeout disables this.

**NOTE** `frame.tap()` requires that the `hasTouch` option of the browser context be set to true.
tap.returnComment: Promise that resolves when the element matching `selector` is successfully tapped.

selector.name: selector
selector.comment: A selector to search for element to tap. If there are multiple elements satisfying the selector, the first will be tapped. See working with selectors for more details.

position.name: position
position.comment: A point to tap relative to the top-left corner of element padding box. If not specified, taps some visible point of the element.

modifiers.name: modifiers
modifiers.comment: Modifier keys to press. Ensures that only these modifiers are pressed during the tap, and then restores current modifiers back. If not specified, currently pressed modifiers are used.

noWaitAfter.name: noWaitAfter
noWaitAfter.comment: Actions that initiate navigations are waiting for these navigations to happen and for pages to start loading. You can opt out of waiting via setting this flag. You would only need this option in the exceptional cases such as navigating to inaccessible pages. Defaults to `false`.
